qas.question: What is the main grouping of a plant know as?
What is the most narrow grouping of a plant?
Do different countries refer to plants by different names?
What part of the name is always capitalized?
How is the entire name usually presented in scientific texts?

context: Kingdom Plantae belongs to Domain Eukarya and is broken down recursively until each species is separately classified. The order is: <a0_0>Kingdom<a0_0/>; Phylum (or Division); Class; Order; Family; Genus (plural genera); <a1_0>Species<a1_0/>. The scientific name of a plant represents its genus and its species within the genus, resulting in a <a2_0>single world-wide name<a2_0/> for each organism. For example, the tiger lily is Lilium columbianum. Lilium is the genus, and columbianum the specific epithet. The combination is the name of the species. When writing the scientific name of an organism, it is proper to capitalise the first letter in <a3_0>the genus<a3_0/> and put all of the specific epithet in lowercase. Additionally, the entire term is ordinarily <a4_0>italicised<a4_0/> (or underlined when italics are not available).
